description: 6.5x50mm Arisaka ammunition, used in a variety of imperial japanese firearms. This is the comparatively new spitzer ammunition, as opposed to the older round-nosed cupronickel versions This means it has decent penetrationm, though still well below a .30-06 round.

6.5x50mm Arisaka ammunition, used in a variety of imperial japanese firearms. This is the older cupronickel variant, meaning theres reduced damage and penetration due to the round-nosed projectile. It may make nice training ammo, though!

6.5x50mm Arisaka ammunition, used in a variety of imperial japanese firearms. This is the comparatively new spitzer ammunition, as opposed to the older round-nosed cupronickel versions. This means it has decent penetrationm, though still slightly below a .30-06 round. The Genso round has a slightly lower powder load, meant to reduce the excessive muzzle flash from shorter barreled rifles, and generally be a better stealth round.

7.7x58mm Arisaka ammunition. Used in World War 2 by the Japanese, this round works well on machine guns and sniper rifles alike as a heavier caliber. It was originally meant to replace 6.5x50mm, but the end of the war prevented that.

7.7x58mm Arisaka ammunition. Used in World War 2 by the Japanese, this round works well on machine guns and sniper rifles alike as a heavier caliber. It was originally meant to replace 6.5x50mm, but the end of the war prevented that. Armor piercing rounds, for shredding light vehicles.

7.7x58mm Arisaka ammunition. Used in World War 2 by the Japanese, this round works well on machine guns and sniper rifles alike as a heavier caliber. It was originally meant to replace 6.5x50mm, but the end of the war prevented that. Tracer rounds; mildly incendiary.

7.7x58mm Arisaka ammunition. Used in World War 2 by the Japanese, this round works well on machine guns and sniper rifles alike as a heavier caliber. It was originally meant to replace 6.5x50mm, but the end of the war prevented that. An explosive variant, this is bound to give anything you shoot ever a bad day.
